fields.description: Confluence allows plugins to add nested menu sections and items. One advantage of having this in JIRA would allow users to add links to their own plugin configuration screen in the admin section.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to plug-in menu sections and items

fields.description:
Downloaded attachments always have the date and time of downloading instead of actual modification/creation date of the file.  It would be best if JIRA kept the actual file modification/creation dates of attached files.

When a file is attached to an e-mail the file date is retained and not changed when it is downloaded.
fields.summary: Attachment file dates should be retained.

fields.description: There are plenty of tasks in JIRA that take a long time to complete (reindexing, bugzilla import, workflow transition, etc). We need a nice mechanism that will allow the user to start one of these tasks and get some form of progress about the task.
fields.summary: Create a generic mechanism within JIRA that allows a user to fire off long running tasks but still receive feedback about the progress of the task.

fields.description: I have noticed several issues in the database across several projects that are related to the browsers "Back" button.  That is because data and state information is not saved prior to actual user execution.  Any user inputed data, queries, attachment selections, etc will all be destroyed if the back button is pressed.  This is extremely frustrating for me because I have a mouse with fwd. and back buttons near my thumb, and I frequently press them accidentally.  I am new to Jira, but have alrady had about 3 incidents that have caused me to loose detailed bug reports.  This costs the company money, and wasted time every incident.  It just seems prudent to prevent this from occuring by either saving the data in a temprorary location, or by warning the user if data has been submitted, and the back button is pressed.  There has got to be a way to either prevent this, or reduce the risk by warning users before it happens.  This issue is too frequently submitted in Jira, and Confluence to ignore.
fields.summary: Back Button Destroys Data

fields.description: On the page for [restoring data|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/restore_data.html#Disabling+email+sending%2Freceiving] it explains what options to set to disable mail handling. This has never worked for me, until finally I figured out how I could get it to work. The instructions should be that one should uncomment the line in setenv.bat/sh and then run startup. That seems to work. When I follow your instructions it doesn't work at all, since I need to be in a DOS command shell to run the command, and running startup.bat like that does nothing. I need to do a Program/Run .. startup.bat to start up JIRA standalone. It would have saved me a lot of time if the instructions for using this switch were clearer.
fields.summary: 'Restoring Data' Documentation incorrect or unclear

fields.description:
Hi, 

Would it be possible to get an "improved" RSS generator in JIRA? It would be nice if the RSS feeds would be a little more "specific" and contained more information.

Examples would be: 
Better / more specific feed titles. Ex: <reportname> - <projectname> @ .....
Adding category fields to the items
  Ex: <category>Comp: Administration</category><category>Vers: 3.6.3 Enterprise</category>

Best regards
Vegard Hamar
fields.summary: Improved RSS Generation

fields.description: Currently the scheme names are not included in the language properties file. For example, "Default Permission Scheme" etc. It would be appreciated if you can include these default scheme names in the language properties file in the next release so we can localize them.
fields.summary: Missing strings in language properties file (pls see screenshots)
Useless Control Flow in AbstractBulkOperationAction.isCanDisableMailNotifications() method

fields.description:
When using [SOAP|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+SOAP+Client], the first step is to obtain the WSDL from JIRA. Say JIRA is running on HTTP (port 8080) and HTTPS (8443). If I request the WSDL via HTTP first:

http://localhost:8080/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl

Then the {{http://localhost:8080}} part is baked into the generated WSDL even for subsequent requests for:
 
https://localhost:8443/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl
fields.summary: WSDL cached, hardcoding contained URLs

fields.description:
When a custom field which is not present on the create issue screen is marked required, new defects cannot be created. When attempting to create the defect, it is rejected with the message "<your custom field> is required"

I have created a custom field, called reviewer, which is only present on the resolve screen. In the field configuration, the reviewer is marked required. Now when attempting to create a defect, the defect is rejected because the reviewer is not present, but the reviewer field is not present on the create screen. The check for the field being required should only happen on screens that contain the custom field.
fields.summary: Fields marked required are required on screens that don't provide them

fields.description: I was creating a 2D portlet and filled in everything except the last field (# of issues), and pressed Save. While it was OK to ask me to fill in the required field, it wiped out everything I had already selected and reverted back to defaults. I didn't even notice until I pressed Save and got a portlet that I didn't ask for.
fields.summary: Saving a 2D portlet without all required fields loses selections

fields.description: I am using the 2D Portlet and trying to group by Security level. We have 1 support project shared by many customers, each of which has their own security level. However, I cannot select Security level as a value to group by in the portlet. Similar to JRA-2925.
fields.summary: Security Level not available as selection in 2D Portlet

fields.description:
I used the Domain of Reporter custom field, and although I changed a user's e-mail address, the field still shows his old domain until a re-index is triggered (either by editing the associated issues, or presumably a system re-index). 
Since users can change their email addresses themselves, an admin would have no way of knowing that a re-index is necessary. On the other hand, re-indexing every issue where the user is a reporter could take a while too.
fields.summary: Changing user's e-mail address did not re-index for Domain of Reporter custom field

fields.description: Sometime screenshot applet does not work (it's permanent problem on Macs, and sometimes Java plugin is not installed on Windows machines), but screenshots still should be uploaded. When uploading screenshots as regular attachments, these files are not marked as screenshots, and no preview generated. JIRA should detect whether uploaded file are images, and make previews if so.
fields.summary: Need ability to upload screenshots without applet

fields.description:
Look at link:

http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/spring/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=&tempMax=1000&decorator=printable&start=0&mode=hide

The report has more then 1000 pages, but link to next page does not work.
fields.summary: Cannot switch pages in printable

fields.description: The Project portlet mode shows a multicoloured bar of Open Issues by Priority.  It would be really nice to be able to reuse this rainbow bar to display any chosen filter by priority in the same way.
fields.summary: Add "Rainbow" style portlet

fields.description:
On bugzilla and RT, when someone send an email to a particular mailing list (pre-configured on the tool) a new issue is created and every one that is associated (generaly another mailling list) receives the information abou the new request. This makes easier for people without the knowledge of Jira or request trackers in general to open requests by just sending an email to the right "person".

Does it exists on Jira ?

thanks
fields.summary: Mailing list creates issue automatically

fields.description:
On bugzilla and RT, every one that reply an email that came from Jira will add this comment to the related issue, but I couldn't make it on Jira, is there a simple way of doing it ?

thank you
fields.summary: Reply email add comment to the issue

fields.description:
On bugzilla I can CC other people involved on the issues so they receive information when the issue changes. I know that Jira have the "watch this issue" thing, but that require action by some people that are not directly involved on the development process and either don't have access to the tool or don't want to and sometimes even don't know how!

Is there a way forcing watches ? Or can you add CCs on the field list ?

thanks
fields.summary: CC more people or force watches

fields.description:
On bugzilla I can associate a mailing list to a project and when someone create a bug without assignee, the whole list will know there's a new but and the right person will get the issue and assign it to himself.

Is there a way of doing it on Jira ?

thanks
fields.summary: Associate a mailing list to a Project so the list receives an email every time an issue is created or updated.

fields.description: we use jira for an international company, so that there are english and german speaking user. if I set a banner, I have to write all the text in German and in English, both texts are displayed to all users. It 'd be better if I can set up banner in default language and translate it later. users will see only their localized banner.
fields.summary: make banner translatable
Further reseach bugs in Oracle 10g drivers when used with Oracle 9i database

fields.description:
The iterator holds a reference to a prepared statement and a result set, so the right way is to close the iterator first and then commit the transaction (which will close the connection).

This needs to be done in:
# WorkflowMigrationManager
# ProWorkflowMigrationManager
fields.summary: Ensure the OfBiz Iterator is closed before the transaction is commited (i.e. connection closed)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10832].
  {panel}

A link in the Notification Schemes section of Administration, to associate projects with notification schemes would be helpful.

I raised support issue JSP-6474 because I couldn't figure out how to do this.  It turned out that it is not possible to associate projects with notification schemes and can only be done the other way, i.e. associating a notification scheme with a project.

It would be great to have an interface similar to the interface in the Issue Schemes section.
Thank you.
fields.summary: Link in Notification Schemes section to associate projects

fields.description:
JIRA Toolkit has some issues tracked in jira.atlassian.com (like JRA-10758, JRA-9237, JRA-8316, JRA-9222 etc).

It should be tracked on http://developer.atlassian.com/jira and its code should be put into subversion. This will require using the cvs2svn script (or any better alternative?) and updating all the docs etc.

JIRA Toolkit may also serve as a good reference point to promote for plugin developers instead of JIRA Developer Kit
fields.summary: Set up JIRA Toolkit SVN and JIRA

fields.description:
I have delete some projects, but there are some one i can't delete. The system shows me an error (see attachemnt).
Also i want to delete some users, but JIRA says me these users has issues asigned, but i can't find the issues.So i can't delete them.
I try in version 3.5.3 too, and i have the same problem.
There is something can i do? i tried in both version, there is something when migrate jira?

Regards.
fields.summary: CAN DELETE SOME PROJECTS/USERS

fields.description:
calling the getProjects() soap request on jira.atlassian.com as a sufficiently privileged user returns an invalid soap response, the HTTP response 500 error page. Specifically it blows up with an OutOfMemory while serialising the response object.

From the respone text:

{noformat}
<pre id="stacktrace">java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: mmAllocLargeArray(jniGetVMThread(env), (ClassP)c, (ObjectP*)res, len)
	at java.util.HashMap.addEntry(ILjava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;I)V(Optimized Method)

	at org.apache.axis.encoding.SerializationContext.serialize(Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Lorg/xml/sax/Attributes;Ljava/lang/Object;Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Ljava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/Boolean;Ljava/lang/Boolean;)V(Optimized Method)

	at org.apache.axis.encoding.SerializationContext.serialize(Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Lorg/xml/sax/Attributes;Ljava/lang/Object;Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Ljava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/Boolean;Ljava/lang/Boolean;)V(Optimized Method)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.SerializationContext.serialize(Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Lorg/xml/sax/Attributes;Ljava/lang/Object;Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Ljava/lang/Class;)V(Optimized Method)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.ser.BeanSerializer.serialize(Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Lorg/xml/sax/Attributes;Ljava/lang/Object;Lorg/apache/axis/encoding/SerializationContext;)V(Optimized Method)
	at org.apache.axis.encoding.SerializationContext.serializeActual(Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Lorg/xml/sax/Attributes;Ljava/lang/Object;Ljavax/xml/namespace/QName;Ljava/lang/Class;Ljava/lang/Boolean;)V(Optimized Method)

	at org.apache.axis.SOAPPart.saveChanges()V(SOAPPart.java:530)
	at org.apache.axis.attachments.AttachmentsImpl.getAttachmentCount()I(AttachmentsImpl.java:554)
	at org.apache.axis.Message.getContentType(Lorg/apache/axis/soap/SOAPConstants;)Ljava/lang/String;(Message.java:486)
	at org.apache.axis.transport.http.AxisServlet.doPost(Ljavax/servlet/http/HttpServletRequest;Ljavax/servlet/http/HttpServletResponse;)V(AxisServlet.java:775)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10827].
  {panel}

When JIRA is configured to create/comment issues from email, it may encounter an email with arbitrary MIME parts (text, HTML, images, videos, etc). Currently JIRA will try to rip such mails apart, attempting to extract text from the HTML, and attaching other bits as attachments.

This is a problem because:

- *No attempt is made to identify "alternative" parts which mean the same thing.* In the case where there is a text/plain part and a text/html part, JIRA will extract the text/plain part as the body of the message, but then as well attempt to attach the text/html part to the issue. This usually fails however, as text/html parts when inline in a message usually denote the HTML version of the plain text, and thus mail clients don't usually bother to attach a filename to the part. This causes a warning message to appear in the logs (see JRA-10825 for more info):
bq. Cannot create attachment without a filename - inline content?
We need to come up with a way to identify these alternative parts, and ignore the redundant parts so that they are not attached to the JIRA issue.

- *This may completely lose the meaning of the email.* For example, the position of inline images may have an impact on the meaning of the message.
fields.summary: Improve parsing of multipart (HTML) emails

fields.description:
If JIRA is configured to [create/comment issues from email|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html], and encounters a mixed HTML/image email with a MIME part:

{noformat}
Content-Type: multipart/related;
    type="text/html"
{noformat}

Then JIRA will fail to parse the HTML part of the email, and logs this:

2006-08-10 14:43:50,452 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Creating attachment without a file.  Aborting

Here are the headers from an email:


{noformat}
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5.7226.0^M
MIME-Version: 1.0^M
Content-Type: multipart/related;^M
        type="text/html";^M
        boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6BB93.375A48EB"^M
.....

This is a multi-part message in MIME format.^M
^M
------_=_NextPart_001_01C6BB93.375A48EB^M
Content-Type: text/html;^M
        charset="iso-8859-1"^M
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable^M
^M
<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =^M
....
{noformat}
fields.summary: POP/IMAP service: JIRA loses HTML part of some (multipart/related) emails

fields.description:
Think of the Out of office message in Microsoft Outlook. You have a message that you re-use all the time. So, it's nice that it stays as the text but you can turn it on or off. With the announcement banner it seems to think it's 'on' if there is any text in it, but it doesn't take into account HTML comments. So, after my upgrade I commented out the announcement, like so:
<!--
<center>
<font color="31289C">
JIRA has been upgraded to version 3.6.3
</center>
</font>
-->
and although it correctly displays nothing, it still shows the brown separator bar.
Is this an improvement? Maybe .. you make the call.
fields.summary: Announcement banner appears as empty brown bar if all contents are within a comment

fields.description:
In Admin -> Global Permissions, we have a "JIRA Users" permission, which is {quote}Ability to login to JIRA. They are a 'user'. Any new users created will automatically join these groups.
Note: All users need this permission to login to JIRA, even if they have other permissions. {quote}

However, after removing all groups from this permission, I am still able to log in. In fact everything works as normal, _except_ for the Profile page, which throws you back to the login screen. This is highly confusing (see [JRA-6887], [JSP-6508|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-6508]).

We should work out what exactly this "permission" is trying to achieve. Is it an über-Browse permission, overriding the permission schemes (in which case it's not doing it's job)? Or is it a "default groups" list (in which case it's not a permission)?
fields.summary: "JIRA Users" global permission broken

fields.description:
The utility will only work on JDK 1.5 but most people now use it. The utility is useful to generate thread dumps programatically when e.g. we cannot obtain an index lock. The thread dump will allow us to see what thread who owns the lock is doing.

The utility should detect if its running on JDK earlier than 1.5 and not do anything except print a log message.
fields.summary: Create a utility that dumps all thread stack traces
Improve Integrity checker

fields.description: Please add a feature that would allow JIRA to clone Projects.
fields.summary: Clone Projects

fields.description:
Is there a way to rename the Identification numbers within JIRA 
> for the Subtasks?
> 
> For example: When you create Tasks, each task is associated with an 
> incremental ID number. <Project>-99
> 
> When creating Sub-tasks, each subtask are also associated with an 
> incremental ID number, in this case, the ID numbers are getting too 
> large and hard to manage.
> 
> Proposed solution: Renaming the ID number for subtasks to be 
> <Project>-99.A for the first sub-task, <Project>-99.B for the second 
> sub-task, <Project>-99.C for the third sub task and so forth.

Having the ID increment after each issue/task creation it is hard to manage.
fields.summary: Identification number of tasks and sub-tasks

fields.description:
When importing issues via the Jelly Runner, non-number versions fail the field validation.  This makes no sense since in the Project administration, you can add any text you please as a version (there's no validation there).  So things such as "3.2a", "Future", "NEXT", "3.3.1b" all fail the importer.

(ex.  in the middle of an exception stack trace: Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Version Id is not a number '1.1 beta 2')

fields.description:
When running the integrity checker I have a few 'issues' which point at Jira issues for clarification. When I follow such a link it opens in the same page thus loosing the results of the check. To return I have to run the check again. 
Would be nicer to open these links in a seperate page by default.
fields.summary: Following link in integrity checker leaves resultpage

fields.description:
Under "Administration" / "General Configuration" / "Edit Configuration" the text for "Allow unassigned issues" reads "Cannot turn off {0} as there are ..." and "Cannot turn off {0} as...".
The placeholder should be replaced with appropriate text or simply be removed. The message can be clearly understood from context so that providing this parameter does not add anything...

There is no priority lower than "trivial" - sorry. :-)
fields.summary: Minor Text (UI) issue in administration page
Add documentation on assigning issues
Create more seemless image insertion/referencing

fields.description: Need to improve on this to show the consistency of user creation via different interfaces (Web, Jelly, SOAP, etc)
fields.summary: SOAP's UserService::createUser() should add user to all groups with USE permission
Create new email visibility setting - Admin Only

fields.description: DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.cacheSchemeEntities is not synchronised and on startup a whole bunch of threads can hit it and bring Jira to its knees before it even gets to its feet.
fields.summary: DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.cacheSchemeEntities is not synchronised

fields.description: When run for Daily, I would expect to see days of the month appear instead of "...", as in attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Recently Created Issues Report doesn't show day #'s

fields.description: Provide ability to rename 1 or several users at a time in all JIRA locations.  For example, people get married or their email addresses change a lot or slightly.  I would also wonder if the datamodel could use an integer pointer instead of hardwired usernames in the several many places that user name (userids) appear within the JIRA tables.
fields.summary: Global user rename - 1:N users

fields.description:
Sorry if I missed this if it was posted already but I cannot find it.

When a pie chart is created the first column of the table view has no title. The cell is empty.
It would seem to be the second drop down "Statistic Type" would be used for this column.
fields.summary: Pie Chart Table... missing title

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10793].
  {panel}

We would like to add a condition to a workflow transition so that only the project lead can execute the transition.

Currently, only

 * Only Assignee Condition
	* Only Reporter Condition
	* Permission Condition
	* Sub-Task Blocking Condition
	* User Is In Group
	* User Is In Group Custom Field

are available, but "Project Lead" is missing (but this would be very useful).
fields.summary: The "Add Condition To Transition" dialog should have a condition "Only Project Lead"

fields.description:
When adding a screenshot to an Issue in the default name of the screenshot is always "screenshot-1.jpg".
This is confusing, if there has already been added a screenshot with this name.
It would be nice if the default name is not a name of an already existing screenshot.
fields.summary: Adding a screenshot dialog shall not suggest a screenshot name that already exists

fields.description: Bulk Operations should run in many small transactions to prevent large locks being created at the database level.
fields.summary: Make sure Bulk Workflow Transition does not run in a single transaction

fields.description: ... 5 other versons [sic] not shown
fields.summary: typo in admin projects page
Make a version's 'Release Date' available as column in Issue Navigator

fields.description: When not logged in and creating a new custom filter on JAC that filters by participant, the user picker popup icon is not shown. Issue can be replicated by logging out of JAC and visiting http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=show&createNew=true
fields.summary: User picker disabled when creating filters anonymously

fields.description: The effect of the bug is wasted memory until next restart of JIRA. The versions and components cannot be accessed once the project is deleted.
fields.summary: When a project is deleted the version and component caches are not flushed.

fields.description: Integrity checker can leak a database connection if an exception occurs during the execution of a check.
fields.summary: Integrity Checker leaks a database connection if an exception occurs during a check

fields.description: This will allow us to simplify the code used by the actions, and also simplify the action hierachy.
fields.summary: Create component for left-hand 'summary' of an issue

fields.description:
At the moment, to ensure that the workflow migration for a project is atomic, the whole operation is performed as one database transaction. If the project has a large number of issues, this approach places to much load on the database.

Need to use a separate transaction for each issue, and ensure that the migration process is able to recover if the migration fails without migrating all issues.
fields.summary: Ensure workflow migrations are not run as one database transaction

fields.description: Currently the date time in our JIRA system is out by about 10 hours. How can we adjust the time on our system - where is the time coming from?
fields.summary: The date time on our JIRA system is incorrect

fields.description: Although I do not use voting, the full content view (HTML or Word) shows Votes in one of the cells.
fields.summary: Full content view shows votes when voting is not enabled

fields.description:
When I am working with issues, I have too many limitations from project and WF administration. I cannot create any additional WF issue status to have ability to group issues in my way.
So I think that here is very simple solution: 
Allow users to create any number of tags to any issue.

Format of tag can be very simple:
Key (text field) and Value (text area).
And user can filter issues by entering pair of key and value.

Good thing would be predefinded profiles of tags:
User can create it`s own predefined tag keys and unite tag keys in profiles/groups.
fields.summary: Need tags (simple format: key=value) which can be attached to any issue and then issues can be filtered by tags (by values of key)

fields.description:
If you can view a project, you are able to view all the linked issues as long as you have access/view rights of the linked projects.

As soon as a link points to an issue that you do not have access rights to, you cannot view the links (or even tell that they are there). This is good and correct functionality. I have attached a screenshot [^jira-users view.JPG] that shows the links that a client can see and a screenshot [^jira-developers view.JPG] that shows the links in the same issue that developers can see. The developers can see all the links.

The problem comes in when the client views the issue after clicking on the "All" link or "Change History" link. Suddenly, the client can view all the links that have been made in the issue *whether they have access rights to those issues or not*. Please see [^Change History shows all links to users.JPG] that shows the Change History for the same issue as shown in [^jira-users view.JPG] and you can see that the jira-user can view all the links even though they should only see one of the links.

In summary, the audit trail (Change History) should only show the links that the user can actually access/view. The other links should be hidden from view.
fields.summary: Links are viewable to users when the link is to an issue in a project that the user does not have access to

fields.description: After completing the import wizard input panel, the wizard loses its context w/out ascertaining that the file write was successful.  When this occurs, all work in completing the wizard is lost.  One of my porject leads has had this happen several times, resulting in considerable frustration.  IT would seme pretty easy to make sure the file was written and if not, request a different location and/ior even have it mailed to the user so the work can be preserved.
fields.summary: CSV Import Wizard gives no warning when unable to write a configuration file and all work is lost.

fields.description: This is only IE (Firefox is Ok). The generated page have the folowing formating with strange carrige return after the double quote:
fields.summary: Dashboard Project issues progess color is blue on IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10776].
  {panel}

"Release" concept managed by JIRA is great. It is at the end the tab the users normally check for more while trying to understand what has to be downloaded, what has been done, ....

On the Release we would like to "link" two other informations:
- the list of installation kits (full name) it is builf of
- the list of sites where it runs

The first can be a simple "attachment" : a document where who has delivered the new Release reports the installation kits (RPMs for linux but any free text to be more general). 

The list of sites can be helpfull as who i running a SW, with a version, might be interested in being logged such to be warned of new releases and, on the other side, the Configuration Control of the SW Company can always know whats running where. To have what I asled for you should also add the "concept" of "site" that can be a special user, with email configrured as any other user.  am only suggetsing a solution but I am sure there are more and more. I am interested in the Configuration Control honestly rather then in the email alert on new releases but this might be of interest of others.

Any suggestion is welcome. DO you have plans in such direction i.e. "expand Release concept" ?

The "attachment" and "sites pane" can be two new links in the Release Tab I attach.
fields.summary: Improve the "Release" related informations

fields.description:
The Created vs Resolved Issues Report shows the number of created and resolved issues (duh).
It would be nice to also show the number of Open issues.
All the needed information seems to be present, only some subtraction is needed.
fields.summary: Add number of Open issues to Created vs Resolved Issues Report

fields.description:
h2. Example:

# In my issue navigator I have a closed issue (Closed export.jpg)
# I press _All fields_ and get a fine export to Excel (Closed Excel.jpg)
# I reopen the issue (Reopened export.jpg)
# Again, I press _All fields_ and now I get an error in Excel (Reopened Excel.jpg)

I have found this problem in several projects and it is always related to an issue with status Reopened. However, it is not caused by all issues in with this status.

{panel:title=The entire error text:}

When requesting issues with RSS view for one custom field value instead of a date I've got an exception. See the excerpt from the xml below. When XML is viewed from the browser, this issue contains a valid date.

      <title>[IDEADEV-8070] Dependant DOM model support</title>

      <description><p>Some DOM models depend on the other's contents, e.g. Struts or JSF config files may be listed in web.xml. We need to fire DOM events on the depending model after some changes in its dependency.</p></description>

	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke(StandardPipeline.java:520)

	at org.apache.jk.server.JkCoyoteHandler.invoke(JkCoyoteHandler.java:300)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)</customfieldvalues>
        </customfield>
        <customfield id="customfield_10011" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:float">

fields.summary: Date custom field contains NPE in search results RSS view (probably a race condition)

fields.description: The built-in reports like "Created vs Resolved Issues Report" create nice screens, but as they lack Excel export (or any export at all) you're screwed when you need to include these results in your own document/report.
fields.summary: Built-in Reports lack Excel export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10768].
  {panel}

Hi,
 
 it would we great, if ther was  a function that would check a release dates against the scheduled amount of work given the team's velocity manually. 

 Also it would be nice to have a similuar function when editing a Release/Version that would calculate the release date if all scheduled issues should be realised.

Best 

Thomas
fields.summary: Version date calculations

fields.description: Incorrect display of the summary field in the horizontal "quick issue creation" form in Internet Explorer. There is a weird behaviour in Internet Explorer in treating the {{<td/>}}'s width and CSS attribute (i.e. textfield{ width: 90%; }). The text field for quick issue creation seems to be shorten to about 2 characters wide.
fields.summary: Incorrect display of the 'New' summary field in quick subtask creation in Internet Explorer

fields.description: Perhaps we should use the base URL.
fields.summary: HyperLink in Word Export should use Base URL as prefix

fields.description:
After restoring the database, and reindexing the issues, the roadmaps are empty for all projects.
We do save the database every night, so the only loss should be the work between the database backup and the restoration.

Any idea to get the roadmaps back ?
fields.summary: Roadmap empty after database restore

fields.description: Make the Integrity Checker operation run as many separate database transactions rather than a single large transaction.
fields.summary: Integrity Checker Transaction refactoring

fields.description: Make the Project Delete operation run as many separate database transactions rather than a single large transaction.
fields.summary: Project Delete Transaction refactoring

fields.description: If a Connection gets closed prematurely before the framework commits or rollsback a transaction, the connection is not cleared from the ThreadLocal and continues to be used by any subsequent transaction - throwing a SQLException (Connection is closed) every time.
fields.summary: Connection is Closed errors if the ThreadLocal connection gets closed before a commit or rollback.

fields.description:
As mentioned deep in the comments of JRA-7068, the RSS URL produced by queries that use the [JIRA Toolkit|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Toolkit] Multi-issue searcher are incorrect. It appears as though all other conditions on the filter are represented in the resulting URL, but no multi-issue keys. Make a query that uses only Multi-issue keys, and the resulting RSS will be the entire database. This makes Multi-issue keys unusable with the Confluence {jiraissues} macro.

Additionally, the PermLink link is also wrong for the same reason. You'll get a filter of the entire DB if you click permlink on a filter that uses only Multi-issue keys.

The comment in JRA-7068 mentions adding "&customfield_10190=JRA-1000,JRA-2000" on the end of the URL (adjusting the custom field # for your installation). This works for both the permlink URL and the RSS URL.

I want to make sure this is tracked in its own right. There is a workaround, but I can't expect my not-always-technical PM's to hack up URLs.
fields.summary: RSS and Permlink URLs are incorrect when using Toolkit multi-issue searcher

fields.description:
[Mercurial SCM|http://www.selenic.com/mercurial/wiki/index.cgi] is gaining traction with the OS community and it would be good to integrate with them.

An unsupported plug-in for Mercurial / JIRA integration can be located here - please direct your questions / comments to the following page:  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Mercurial+Plugin
fields.summary: Integrate with Mercurial Source Control Management

fields.description: Added a test for the cascading select custom field since users have had difficulties trying to work out just 'how' to do it.
fields.summary: Add a test for a cascading select custom field in the SOAP client

fields.description:
If we create a generic SCC library that can communicate with any SCC compliant code repository (most have it).

More info on the API can be found at - http://alinconstantin.homeip.net/webdocs/scc/msscci.htm

There is an Eclipse feature request as well for integration - https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=23821 (Would we dare contribute to Eclipse)...
fields.summary: Make a Generic Source Control interface based on SCC

fields.description:
Is it possible to add the status icon in the *Show Saved Filter* portlets (Similar as the *My Votes* portlet).

Thanks,
Thiago
fields.summary: Status icon in Show Saved Filter portlets

fields.description: If I am the stakeholder of the original bug which no one has reviewed or accepted then I am intrigued to know why there is not a 'delete' option on the left taskbar where the 'edit' option sits along with everything else except delete.
fields.summary: Where is the 'Delete bug' option

fields.description:
The indecator bars are all a blue tone instead of a red/green one. 
3.6.2 did not have the problem, and in Firefox the bars are displayed OK.

Unfortunately our clients all use IE.
fields.summary: Projects overview indicator bars are all blue toned in IE
Bulk add subtask

fields.description: Having created a portal it would be good to be able to share this with a particuilar group
fields.summary: Sharing of Portals between users and or groups

fields.description:
running against http://jira.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl

using latest out-of-the-box visual studio 2005.
Created a c# console project, added a web reference to http://jira.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl

then executed this code:
#com.atlassian.jira.JiraSoapServiceService svc = new com.atlassian.jira.JiraSoapServiceService();
#Console.WriteLine(svc.login("soaptester", "soaptester"));


blew up with:
Client found response content type of 'text/plain; charset=UTF-8', but expected 'text/xml'.
The request failed with the error message:
--
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"><soapenv:Body><ns1:loginResponse soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com"><loginReturn xsi:type="xsd:string">0UR3Aa1083</loginReturn></ns1:loginResponse></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>
--.


suggests the repsonse mime type is set to 'text/plain; charset=UTF-8' which aint valid.
fields.summary: Visual studio 2005 c# client breaks on calling jira soap service
WIKI markup in Project description
Show TransitionView -Name in WorkflowSteps-View

fields.description:
If another user transitions an issue that a user has selected for builk transition, the issue transition fails but the index is updated with the stale issue object value.

To replicate, select some issues for bulk edit, then in another browser transition one of the issues. Run the transition, then check the edited issue status in the navigator.
fields.summary: Bulk Workflow Transition causes index corruption if an Issue is concurrently transitioned during the issue/operation selection phase.
Even when email images are blocked, formatting should be nice

fields.description: When you choose to save a Jira issue to Word, the description field is saved twice in the resulting doc.  Once, it is formatted correctly. The second time it is shown w/o line breaks. Please see attached samples.
fields.summary: Description appears twice when saving jira issue to Word

fields.description:
If an upgrade fails, people quite often just point their old instance against their new data.

This can have bad effects, esp. when they upgrade again or if they do an export and import.

Jira should fail to start (or just display an error message) if this happens.
A check should also be done when importing data.  Not sure if it si possible, but you should check to see if the data is from the smae version or earlier.
fields.summary: Shouldn't be able to start up Jira against a new versions data

fields.description:
Update the atlassian-plugins and the ManagePlugins action so that JIRA can accept user-uploaded plugins like confluence.

This is checked in on the branch "plugin_manager_upgrade_branch".


This code depends on their being a jira.plugins.path for user uploaded plugins. I've written the code to configure it on setup, but nothing yet for existing installations. We're going to need an upgrade task of some kind.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to upload and uninstall plugins

fields.description:
We have configured our edit issue screens to remove, amongst other things, the reporter field to prevent someone from changing the reporter.  Today, one of our developers, by mistake, did a bulk edit operation and managed to hit the reporter instead of the assignee field.  

Given the amount of grief this caused today, this is a critical issue. 

One of two things would be fine...

1.  Make the bulk edit screen always be consistent with the single issue edit screen in terms of fields displayed
2.  Or...slightly more  flexible...provide for a seperate bulk edit screen that can be modified using the screen editor
fields.summary: Bulk edit screen shows superset of all fields utilized by a project=> should only be those shown on the edit issue screen.

fields.description:
I was typing in comments or notes to a Jira issue, and then clicked Create, only to find out that I was not logged in, and all the notes i had made were lost.

Is there any way to allow me to login without loosing that information?
fields.summary: Loosing text typed into and issue when you have been logged out or timed out
User profile searching from user profile
Horizontal scrollbar needed in Issue Navigator for e.g. Fix For
Perpetual edit screen mode (rather than the default click to edit method)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10726].
  {panel}

Create a listener that creates sub-tasks when the versions are modified.

This would promote the use of sub-tasks to track fixes different branches.

Have an option to sync subtask list with Affects or Fix-for.

(Though I guess this could be implemented as a multi-select custom field that contains the different branches and creates subtasks when a branch is selected)
fields.summary: Create subtasks on issue version updates

fields.description:
I'm talking about the red/green bar in the portlets on the home page. See my screenshots. In Firefox, they look fine, but in IE, the colors are shades of blue and the bar itself is rendered too large.

By tweaking the html itself, I know what causes the colors. There is extra whitespace in the bgcolor tag (inside the quotes), and IE is botching the rendering. I don't know what's causing the size problem.
fields.summary: Status portlets on home page don't render right in IE

fields.description: On several occassions, we've had issues that don't show up in the issue navigator but can be found by using the find functionality (when looking at ALL issues). I had a specific occurrence of this yesterday and once I went in to resolve the issue, it then began to show up in the issue navigator. We've looked at the issues to see if we could see some reason why they wouldn't show up but nothing pops out at us.
fields.summary: Issue missing from Issue Navigator when viewing all Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10702].
  {panel}

I would like to use JIRA not only for bugs/SPRs but also to track Actions, Change Requests, Non Conformance Reports, Review Item Discrepancies i.e. a number of different "issue" that have reason to exist in a medium/large IT project. 

I have configured such different issues , each one with special fields. Fine. 
Nowadays, as far as I understood, the "identifier" of the issue is "unique per project". 
Would it be possible to configure a project to have it "unique per issue" ? 
Is this feature a possible "improvement" in JIRA system roadmap? 

At the end, issue idenfier might be configured as <projectid>-<issue type>-<autoinc numeric field>, such as "JRA-BUG-7777", "JRA-TSK-7777", "JRA-CHR-7777" and so on. maybe to clean it up, one should fix the leght of the first two field, as an example, to 3 digits.

This would have benefit also on the "RoadMap" view where now imporvement and bugs are not distiguishable by the name (see screeenshot)
fields.summary: Issue identifiers are unique perProject : I would have them unique per issue type withing a project
